sections.sectionTitle: Presentation on the subject of the tsunami in the Pacific in 2011

questions.question: What point does the speaker make about the number of deaths in the tsunami?
options: A: The figures were much lower than the speaker had anticipated.
B: It was the highest figure for any tsunami in history.
C: The actual figure was much lower than the initial estimate.

questions.question: What is the speaker’s main point about the cause of the tsunami?
options: A: The tectonic plates in the area are sliding past each other.
B: The tremor was caused by a slight movement of the ocean floor.
C: The earthquake was one of a series of large tremors.

questions.question: Why did the area have so little warning of the tsunami?
options: A: The fault line had been assumed to be inactive.
B: The only warning was an undersea light signal.
C: The land had not moved significantly.

questions.question: What is the speaker’s main point about the effect of the tsunami on farming?
options: A: Salt-water contamination has made the land unsuitable for all crops.
B: Some farmers are now managing to grow rice as before.
C: The area may take decades to recover.

questions.question: What is the speaker’s main point about the effect of the tsunami on fishing?
options: A: There has been a huge rise in food prices in the world.
B: The fishing industry may never return to pre-tsunami levels.
C: It has led to an increase in the number of fishing boats.
